alert.note: Alert for Gage; Pawnee (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:05PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Pawnee and southern Gage Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 405 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Holmesville, or 6 miles south of Beatrice, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wymore and Holmesville around 410 PM CDT. Blue Springs around 415 PM CDT. Barneston around 420 PM CDT. Liberty around 425 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Burchard and Summerfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
